intro: Clerodendrum bolivianum, commonly known as the Bolivian flame bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
